eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils

Class Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils.Configuration

  • public final class Configuration
extends Object
    Parser of user-specified configuration files to be used during transformation of geospatial features into RDF triples.
    Version:
    1.4
    Author:
    Kostas Patroumpas

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      String attrCategory
      Name of the attribute specifying the category of a feature according to a classification scheme.
      String attrGeometry
      Name of the attribute containing the geometry of a feature.
      String attrKey
      Name of the input attribute containing a unique identifier of each feature.
      String attrName
      Name of the attribute specifying the main name of a feature.
      String attrX
      Name of the attribute containing the X-ordinate (or longitude) of a feature.
      String attrY
      Name of the attribute containing the Y-ordinate (or latitude) of a feature.
      int batch_size
      Default number of entities (i.e., records) to handle in each batch (applicable to STREAM and RML modes).
      String classificationSpec
      Path to a file specifying a classification hierarchy with categories assigned to features in the dataset.
      boolean classifyByName
      Specifies whether the join attribute with the classification scheme is based on the category identifier (false) or the actual name of the category (true).
      String dbHost
      JDBC parameter for the host name (or IP address) of the computer hosting the database.
      String dbName
      JDBC parameter for the name of the database to connect to.
      String dbPassword
      JDBC parameter for the password in the database connection.
      int dbPort
      JDBC parameter for the port number on which the database in the host computer accepts user requests.
      String dbType
      Type of database connection.
      String dbUserName
      JDBC parameter for the username in the database connection.
      String defaultLang
      Default language specification tag for string literals.
      char delimiter
      Delimiter character for CSV file data sources.
      String encoding
      Encoding used for strings.
      String featureClassificationNS
      Namespace for the classification scheme employed for the features.
      String featureClassNS
      Namespace for the URIs of the category assigned to each feature.
      String featureNS
      Namespace for feature URIs.
      String featureSource
      String specifying the data source (provider) of the input dataset(s).
      String featureSourceNS
      Namespace for the data source URI assigned to each feature.
      String filterSQLCondition
      SQL filter to be applied on the database table.
      String geometryNS
      Geometry namespace for WKT literals and spatial properties.
      String inputFiles
      Path to file(s) containing input dataset(s).
      String inputFormat
      Format of input data.
      String mappingSpec
      Path to a file containing mappings of attributes from input schema to RDF properties.
      String mode
      Transformation mode: (disk-based) GRAPH, (in-memory) STREAM, (in-memory) XSLT, or RML.
      String[] namespaces
      List of namespaces corresponding to the prefixes.
      String ontologyNS
      Ontology namespace of each transformed feature.
      String outputDir
      Path to the directory where output files will be written.
      String[] prefixes
      List of prefixes for namespaces employed in the transformation.
      char quote
      Quote character for strings in CSV file data sources.
      boolean registerFeatures
      Indicates whether to export a CSV file with records for the SLIPO Registry.
      String serialization
      Output RDF serialization.
      String sourceCRS
      Spatial reference system (EPSG code) of the input dataset.
      String tableName
      Name of the database table (or view) where the features will be retrieved from.
      String targetCRS
      Spatial reference system (EPSG code) of geometries in the output RDF triples.
      String targetGeoOntology
      Specifies the spatial ontology for geometries in the exported RDF data.
      String tmpDir
      Path to a directory where intermediate files may be temporarily written during transformation.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Configuration(String path)
      Constructor of a Configuration object.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • mode

        public String mode
        Transformation mode: (disk-based) GRAPH, (in-memory) STREAM, (in-memory) XSLT, or RML.

      • inputFormat

        public String inputFormat
        Format of input data. Supported formats: SHAPEFILE, DBMS, CSV, GPX, GEOJSON, XML, OSM.

      • inputFiles

        public String inputFiles
        Path to file(s) containing input dataset(s). Multiple input files (of exactly the same format and attributes) can be specified, separating them by ';' in order to activate multiple concurrent threads for their transformation.

      • tmpDir

        public String tmpDir
        Path to a directory where intermediate files may be temporarily written during transformation.

      • outputDir

        public String outputDir
        Path to the directory where output files will be written. By convention, output RDF files have the same name as their corresponding input dataset.

      • batch_size

        public int batch_size
        Default number of entities (i.e., records) to handle in each batch (applicable to STREAM and RML modes).

      • mappingSpec

        public String mappingSpec
        Path to a file containing mappings of attributes from input schema to RDF properties.

      • classificationSpec

        public String classificationSpec
        Path to a file specifying a classification hierarchy with categories assigned to features in the dataset.

      • classifyByName

        public boolean classifyByName
        Specifies whether the join attribute with the classification scheme is based on the category identifier (false) or the actual name of the category (true). By default, transformation uses identifiers of categories in the classification scheme. This parameter has no effect if no classification hierarchy has been specified.

      • serialization

        public String serialization
        Output RDF serialization. Supported formats: RDF/XML (default), RDF/XML-ABBREV, N-TRIPLES, TURTLE (or TTL), N3.

      • targetGeoOntology

        public String targetGeoOntology
        Specifies the spatial ontology for geometries in the exported RDF data. Possible values: 1) "GeoSPARQL", 2) "Virtuoso" (legacy RDF ontology for points only), 3) "wgs84_pos" (for WGS84 Geoposition RDF vocabulary).

      • prefixes

        public String[] prefixes
        List of prefixes for namespaces employed in the transformation.

      • namespaces

        public String[] namespaces
        List of namespaces corresponding to the prefixes.

      • ontologyNS

        public String ontologyNS
        Ontology namespace of each transformed feature.

      • geometryNS

        public String geometryNS
        Geometry namespace for WKT literals and spatial properties.

      • featureNS

        public String featureNS
        Namespace for feature URIs.

      • featureClassNS

        public String featureClassNS
        Namespace for the URIs of the category assigned to each feature.

      • featureClassificationNS

        public String featureClassificationNS
        Namespace for the classification scheme employed for the features.

      • featureSourceNS

        public String featureSourceNS
        Namespace for the data source URI assigned to each feature.

      • defaultLang

        public String defaultLang
        Default language specification tag for string literals.

      • featureSource

        public String featureSource
        String specifying the data source (provider) of the input dataset(s).

      • tableName

        public String tableName
        Name of the database table (or view) where the features will be retrieved from.

      • filterSQLCondition

        public String filterSQLCondition
        SQL filter to be applied on the database table.

      • attrKey

        public String attrKey
        Name of the input attribute containing a unique identifier of each feature.

      • attrGeometry

        public String attrGeometry
        Name of the attribute containing the geometry of a feature.

      • attrName

        public String attrName
        Name of the attribute specifying the main name of a feature.

      • attrCategory

        public String attrCategory
        Name of the attribute specifying the category of a feature according to a classification scheme.

      • attrX

        public String attrX
        Name of the attribute containing the X-ordinate (or longitude) of a feature. Ignored in case that attrGeometry has been specified.

      • attrY

        public String attrY
        Name of the attribute containing the Y-ordinate (or latitude) of a feature. Ignored in case that attrGeometry has been specified.

      • registerFeatures

        public boolean registerFeatures
        Indicates whether to export a CSV file with records for the SLIPO Registry. CAUTION! This functionality is applicable in the context of the SLIPO Workbench only.

      • delimiter

        public char delimiter
        Delimiter character for CSV file data sources. Mandatory for CSV input; ignored otherwise.

      • quote

        public char quote
        Quote character for strings in CSV file data sources. Mandatory for CSV input; ignored otherwise.

      • encoding

        public String encoding
        Encoding used for strings. Default encoding: UTF-8.

      • sourceCRS

        public String sourceCRS
        Spatial reference system (EPSG code) of the input dataset. If omitted, geometries are assumed in WGS84 reference system (EPSG:4326). Example: EPSG:2100

      • targetCRS

        public String targetCRS
        Spatial reference system (EPSG code) of geometries in the output RDF triples. If omitted, RDF geometries will retain their original georeference (i.e., no reprojection of coordinates will take place). Example: EPSG:4326

      • dbType

        public String dbType
        Type of database connection. Possible values: MSAccess; MySQL; Oracle; PostGIS; DB2; SQLServer; SpatiaLite.

      • dbName

        public String dbName
        JDBC parameter for the name of the database to connect to.

      • dbUserName

        public String dbUserName
        JDBC parameter for the username in the database connection.

      • dbPassword

        public String dbPassword
        JDBC parameter for the password in the database connection.

      • dbHost

        public String dbHost
        JDBC parameter for the host name (or IP address) of the computer hosting the database.

      • dbPort

        public int dbPort
        JDBC parameter for the port number on which the database in the host computer accepts user requests.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Configuration

        public Configuration(String path)
        Constructor of a Configuration object.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to a properties file containing all parameters to be used in the transformation.
